reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good character description, and a good element of surprise. A bit too much scenery investment - ok, we got it was a difficult and magnificent climb, "don't try at home," but it was a bit too much scenery.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I read this in one day… what a wild ride! Great story, believable characters… lots of twists and turns.. I loved this book. Wish there were more like this out there!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent action and outdoors thriller
reviews.reviewText: This book wins for amount of times “Mm” is said in different dialogue scenes to the point that it subtly grated on my nerves. I, however, much rather enjoyed Milena’s perspective than the main character Anna’s. There was a tenderness and a human vulnerability to Milena, even if she is a little meek and submissive at times, unlike Anna who remains mighty high on herself and quite unlikeable in moments.The ending is inconclusive and every character unreliable to the point that the reader’s grasp on reality, too, is challenged. I thought that that was the most effective and original as truth, perspective, and someone’s general positionally is subjective and can constantly be called into question and interrogated.Every year, Anna, her fiancé, Henrik, and good friend, Milena, go hiking deep in the mountains in Sweden, but this year it’s different. Milena wants her boyfriend, hiking and outdoors aficionado, Jacob, to come. Reluctantly, Anna and Henrik agree with some hesitation as there’s something strangely, eerily familiar about Jacob to Anna that she can’t quite put her finger on. The more that time goes on the more violent things and characters become. Jacob is an all-around wildcard and while the story dragged a bit midway through, I thought closer to the ending really had me. If you enjoy action and outdoors thrillers this one is a decent read and had me hanging my head in despair at the tragic outcome of one of the characters and what could’ve been.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is the kind of book I like! I haven’t had a lot of luck with books lately. This kept me guessing and had a great ending, which is unusual.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Know Your Friends...Or Else!
reviews.reviewText: It's been a long time since I've been blown away by a book I've read. Well, consider Jack effectively knocked off his feet!Ulf Kvensler's "The Couples Trip" is (IMHO) a spellbinding tale of two couples who go on a long hike through the Nordic wilderness. Although the author captivates us with intricate descriptions of the countryside's spectacular scenery, the real story is revealed as the couples' relationships decay into something far more sinister than mere petty bickering. It's well to embrace the old maxim "all is not as it appears" as you course through the pages of this book. Justifiably, this book was bestowed with the Swedish Academy of Crime Writers' award as "Best Debut of the Year."Read - enjoy - then ruminate over the literal feast presented to you by a true master storyteller named Kvensler.Move over Michael Connelly - there's a new boss in town.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars An ending maybe?
reviews.reviewText: Started well, the plot was paced well and interesting. The last quarter was even exciting, I couldn't wait to discover who had done what to whom. I'm still waiting, but I ran out of book. It's one thing to let it end with some questions, but you still have to end the damn thing. I paid enough for the book to include an ending, not very happy, will not recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Get your passport ready! We’re off to Sweden!
reviews.reviewText: Anna and Henrik are set to rendezvous with their friend Milena for an annual hike. But this year everything is different.For starters, Henrik is less than enthusiastic to go. Helplessly watching his academic career fade away, he can’t muster the motivation to train for the hike.And Milena is bringing her boyfriend Jacob, who neither Anna or Henrik know.When the two couples set off for their hike, Muriel’s new man suddenly commandeers the getaway and plots a new course. One that will require tremendous skill, adding even more danger to the hike. Question: Is everyone up for this? I think not!As the hike begins and the altitude increases so does the tension between the couples. Is it too late to turn around before someone gets seriously hurt?This was an atmospheric read, allowing me to just sit back and lose myself in the magical beauty of the Swedish mountainside.I listened to the audio and Karen Cass did an amazing job of bringing the characters and storyline to life!My only drawback was the ending. It left me confused and feeling like something was left out or possibly lost in translation. I needed more clarity and closure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Don’t read until you’ve finished the book!
reviews.reviewText: Loved the descriptions of the journey. I do hike but not to this extreme. However reading about it was very enjoyable and the scenery came alive in my mind. Also thought it was a very easy read with only four main characters.Some have given lower ratings due to ending but I think it really opens up lots of thinking and room for discussion. My partner and I read it at the same time. We concluded that we would never know who killed Jacob but Milena made sure Anna took the blame. Anna tried to save Milena and Milena even confirmed that. If Anna had murdered Jacob, as opposed to killing him in self defense, she wouldn’t want to leave a witness. And if Milena killed him, to save Anna, Anna would again try yo save her friend’s life.
Very interesting story and well written. Can’t put it down. Highly recommend!
